policy.description:
Identify RDS instances with no recent activity. These RDS instances can
be investigated and if they are no longer needed should be deleted.
policy.name: cost-aws:aws-rds-instance-unused-inform
policy.source:
{"description": "Identify RDS instances with no recent activity.
", "filters": [{"key": "InstanceCreateTime", "op": "greater-than", "type": "value", "value": 30, "value_type": "age"}, {"days": 14, "missing-value": 0, "name": "DatabaseConnections", "op": "equal", "statistics": "Sum", "type": "metrics", "value": 0}], "metadata": {"autoremediable": true, "category": ["security/data-management/unused", "cost/efficiency/business-value"], "classification": [{"pillar": "security", "scope": "unused", "segment": "attack-surface", "severity": "high"}, {"pillar": "finops", "scope": "business-value", "segment": "efficiency", "severity": "high"}], "compliance": [{"control-mappings": ["1.3.6"], "type": "Cost", "version": "1.0.0"}], "creator": "Stacklet", "long-description": "Identify RDS instances with no recent activity. These RDS instances can
be investigated and if they are no longer needed should be deleted.
", "recommended_actions": {"remediation": [{"content": "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/USER_StopInstance.html", "description": "Review and stop RDS database instances that are temporarily or no
longer in use.
", "name": "AWS Docs", "performance_opportunity": 0, "saving_opportunity": 100, "type": "link"}, {"content": "https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/rds.html#aws-rds-actions-stop", "description": "Stops RDS database instances identified by the policy filters.
", "name": "Policy Action", "performance_opportunity": 0, "saving_opportunity": 100, "type": "link"}, {"content": "https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/rds.html#aws-rds-actions-delete", "description": "Deletes RDS database instances identified by the policy filters.
", "name": "Policy Action", "performance_opportunity": 0, "saving_opportunity": 100, "type": "link"}]}, "remediation_effort": "high", "remediation_risk": "high", "severity": "high"}, "name": "aws-rds-instance-unused-inform", "resource": "aws.rds"}
policy.sourceYAML:
policies:
- name: aws-rds-instance-unused-inform
  resource: aws.rds
  description: Identify RDS instances with no recent activity.
  metadata:
    autoremediable: true
    category:
    - security/data-management/unused
    - cost/efficiency/business-value
    classification:
    - pillar: security
      scope: unused
      segment: attack-surface
      severity: high
    - pillar: finops
      scope: business-value
      segment: efficiency
      severity: high
    compliance:
    - type: Cost
      control-mappings:
      - 1.3.6
      version: 1.0.0
    creator: Stacklet
    long-description: Identify RDS instances with no recent activity. These RDS instances
      can be investigated and if they are no longer needed should be deleted.
    recommended_actions:
      remediation:
      - name: AWS Docs
        description: Review and stop RDS database instances that are temporarily or
          no longer in use.
        type: link
        content: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/USER_StopInstance.html
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
      - name: Policy Action
        description: Stops RDS database instances identified by the policy filters.
        type: link
        content: https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/rds.html#aws-rds-actions-stop
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
      - name: Policy Action
        description: Deletes RDS database instances identified by the policy filters.
        type: link
        content: https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/rds.html#aws-rds-actions-delete
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
    remediation_effort: high
    remediation_risk: high
    severity: high
  filters:
  - type: value
    key: InstanceCreateTime
    op: greater-than
    value: 30
    value_type: age
  - name: DatabaseConnections
    type: metrics
    days: 14
    missing-value: 0
    op: equal
    statistics: Sum
    value: 0

", "name": "Policy Action", "performance_opportunity": 0, "saving_opportunity": 100, "type": "link"}, {"content": "https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/rds.html#aws-rds-actions-delete", "description": "Deletes RDS database instances identified by the policy filters.
", "name": "Policy Action", "performance_opportunity": 0, "saving_opportunity": 100, "type": "link"}]}, "remediation_effort": "high", "remediation_risk": "high", "severity": "high"}, "name": "aws-rds-instance-unused-inform", "resource": "aws.rds"}
policy.sourceYAML:
policies:
- name: aws-rds-instance-unused-inform
  resource: aws.rds
  description: Identify RDS instances with no recent activity.
  metadata:
    autoremediable: true
    category:
    - security/data-management/unused
    - cost/efficiency/business-value
    classification:
    - pillar: security
      scope: unused
      segment: attack-surface
      severity: high
    - pillar: finops
      scope: business-value
      segment: efficiency
      severity: high
    compliance:
    - type: Cost
      control-mappings:
      - 1.3.6
      version: 1.0.0
    creator: Stacklet
    long-description: Identify RDS instances with no recent activity. These RDS instances
      can be investigated and if they are no longer needed should be deleted.
    recommended_actions:
      remediation:
      - name: AWS Docs
        description: Review and stop RDS database instances that are temporarily or
          no longer in use.
        type: link
        content: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/USER_StopInstance.html
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
      - name: Policy Action
        description: Stops RDS database instances identified by the policy filters.
        type: link
        content: https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/rds.html#aws-rds-actions-stop
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
      - name: Policy Action
        description: Deletes RDS database instances identified by the policy filters.
        type: link
        content: https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/rds.html#aws-rds-actions-delete
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
    remediation_effort: high
    remediation_risk: high
    severity: high
  filters:
  - type: value
    key: InstanceCreateTime
    op: greater-than
    value: 30
    value_type: age
  - name: DatabaseConnections
    type: metrics
    days: 14
    missing-value: 0
    op: equal
    statistics: Sum
    value: 0

deleted.

    - security/data-management/unused
    - cost/efficiency/business-value
    classification:
    - pillar: security
      scope: unused
      segment: attack-surface
      severity: high
    - pillar: finops
      scope: business-value
      segment: efficiency
      severity: high
    compliance:
    - type: Cost
      control-mappings:
      - 1.3.8
      version: 1.0.0
    creator: Stacklet
    long-description: Identify Redshift clusters with no recent activity. These Redshift
      clusters can be investigated and if they are no longer needed should be deleted.
    recommended_actions:
      remediation:
      - name: AWS Docs
        description: Review and pause Redshift clusters that are temporarily or no
          longer in use.
        type: link
        content: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/mgmt/managing-cluster-operations.html
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
      - name: Policy Action
        description: Pauses Redshift clusters identified by the policy filters.
        type: link
        content: https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/redshift.html#aws-redshift-actions-pause
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
      - name: Policy Action
        description: Deletes Redshift clusters identified by the policy filters.
        type: link
        content: https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/redshift.html#aws-redshift-actions-delete
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
    remediation_effort: high
    remediation_risk: high
    severity: high
  filters:
  - type: value
    key: ClusterCreateTime
    op: greater-than
    value: 30
    value_type: age
  - name: DatabaseConnections
    type: metrics
    days: 14
    missing-value: 0
    op: equal
    statistics: Sum
    value: 0

policy.description:
Identify Redshift clusters with no recent activity. These Redshift
clusters can be investigated and if they are no longer needed should be
deleted.

policies:
- name: aws-redshift-unused-inform
  resource: aws.redshift
  description: Identify Redshift clusters with no recent activity.
  metadata:
    autoremediable: true
    category:
    - security/data-management/unused
    - cost/efficiency/business-value
    classification:
    - pillar: security
      scope: unused
      segment: attack-surface
      severity: high
    - pillar: finops
      scope: business-value
      segment: efficiency
      severity: high
    compliance:
    - type: Cost
      control-mappings:
      - 1.3.8
      version: 1.0.0
    creator: Stacklet
    long-description: Identify Redshift clusters with no recent activity. These Redshift
      clusters can be investigated and if they are no longer needed should be deleted.
    recommended_actions:
      remediation:
      - name: AWS Docs
        description: Review and pause Redshift clusters that are temporarily or no
          longer in use.
        type: link
        content: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/redshift/latest/mgmt/managing-cluster-operations.html
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
      - name: Policy Action
        description: Pauses Redshift clusters identified by the policy filters.
        type: link
        content: https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/redshift.html#aws-redshift-actions-pause
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
      - name: Policy Action
        description: Deletes Redshift clusters identified by the policy filters.
        type: link
        content: https://cloudcustodian.io/docs/aws/resources/redshift.html#aws-redshift-actions-delete
        performance_opportunity: 0
        saving_opportunity: 100
    remediation_effort: high
    remediation_risk: high
    severity: high
  filters:
  - type: value
    key: ClusterCreateTime
    op: greater-than
    value: 30
    value_type: age
  - name: DatabaseConnections
    type: metrics
    days: 14
    missing-value: 0
    op: equal
    statistics: Sum
    value: 0
